data.meta_description: The Battle of Fort Velasco in 1832 was one of a series of conflicts that eventually led to the Texas Revolution of 1835-36. While politics would shift and‚Ä¶
data.text:
Kyriakos Mitsotakis : Dear friends, as Greeks we are surrounded by history and as Greeks we are acutely aware of the importance of that history, which is why evenings like this matter. Because as custodians of Greece‚Äôs ancient history, the preservation, protection, and promotion of Greek antiquity isn‚Äôt just important, it is inviolable, a duty and a commitment never to be broken. Yes, that means that part of my mission as Prime Minister is about ensuring the return of Greek artefacts to Greece. But it also means that I have a duty to ensure that in doing that, these collections are also available to as wide an audience as possible. https://lnkd.in/duAV7PdV

#Regeneration is required in Europe! This short documentary by Ramy Fouda and Estelle Genoux tells the story of how a valley preserved since the beginning of time, a sanctuary in which the keys of life have been kept, la vall√©e √©ternelle (The Eternal Valley). If you think we've explored everything there is to explore on Earth, think again. Follow fabrice leclerc on his mission to accelerate the reconnection of humankind with Life. https://lnkd.in/d9GSmXK5

This is what you get when you are visited by russian (Christian? üòù ) culture: ~400 #CulturalHeritage sites damaged since the beginning of the full-scale invasion as verified by UNESCO: üëâ 137 religious sites üëâ 191 buildings of historical or artistic interest üëâ 31 museums üëâ 25 monuments üëâ 15 libraries üëâ 1 archive. All of it are #WarCrimes, as such objects are protected by the #HagueConvention.

This is a handwritten page from "The Problem of Thor Bridge," a Sherlock Holmes story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. The top right of the document shows Doyle had originally titled the story "The Adventure of the Second Clip," which he then crossed out. Have you ever read this murder mystery? #history #historymuseum #museum #museums #historic #historybuff #historyfan #historyfacts #historyfact #didyouknow #staugustine #santabarbara #education #sherlockholmes #sherlock #literature

April is Genocide Awareness and Prevention month. The Museum of Us, like other museums and related institutions, holds massive amounts of cultural resources and ancestral remains from Indigenous communities. Many 20th century museums and researchers believed that Indigenous cultures were ‚Äúdisappearing‚Äù and needed to be preserved and studied. This belief ignored the history of genocide and removal of Indigenous peoples from their ancestral homelands by colonists and the U.S. government from the 1600‚Äôs into the present. This narrative of ‚Äúvanishing‚Äù or ‚Äúextinction‚Äù presents Indigenous cultures and communities as peoples of the past‚Äìcontinuing the silencing and erasure of their humanity. Learn more about the Museum‚Äôs history and ongoing decolonizing initiatives to become a better community space for all at museumofus.org/history

Scattered about the edges of the Mediterranean Sea are bastions of history, relics of bygone areas and architectural bones of ancient metropolises. Whether you‚Äôre a devout history buff or just have an innate sense of adventure, here are three destinations you should seek out when searching for unique experiences off the beaten path.

Exploring the true history of Israel/Palestine. üèû It's time to set the record straight and acknowledge the stories of the land's first settlers, those who have a deep-rooted connection to this beautiful place. Let's shed light on the historical facts and dispel the misconceptions that have clouded its rich heritage. By understanding our shared history, we can build a more inclusive and respectful future. Join me on this journey of discovery. #HistoryMatters #LandOwnership #SharedHeritage"
